UNITED STATES CODE
Title 28 - Due Process Rights

Chapter 87 - DUE PROCESS RIGHTS

§ 7022. Due Process Rights provisions

(a) GENERAL RULE.—The provisions of this section shall apply to all matters involving due process rights under federal jurisdiction.

(b) DEFINITIONS.—In this section:
    (1) The term "due process rights" means the legal framework, procedures, and standards established for due process rights under federal law.
    (2) The term "federal jurisdiction" means the authority exercised by federal courts and agencies.

(c) REQUIREMENTS.—
    (1) All covered entities must comply with federal standards for due process rights.
    (2) Compliance includes adherence to procedural requirements and substantive standards.
    (3) Documentation and reporting requirements must be satisfied as specified.

(d) ENFORCEMENT.—
    The Attorney General may bring enforcement actions for violations of due process rights requirements. Civil penalties and injunctive relief are available remedies.

(e) EFFECTIVE DATE.—This section shall take effect 128 days after the date of enactment.

(f) REGULATIONS.—The Secretary may prescribe regulations necessary to carry out this section.

Enacted: 2022-10-22
Public Law: 114-74
